explains: adj. 骚乱的，动乱的；（气流）湍流的，（水）湍急的； 骚动的，混乱而难以控制的；（技）（与）紊流（有关）的，（与）湍流（有关）的
wordGroup: turbulent boundary layer 湍流边界层；紊两面层
turbulent fluctuation n. 紊流脉动；紊动

sentences.en: I had to have a boat that could handle turbulent seas.
sentences.cn: 我必须有一条能应付汹涌海浪的船。

sentences.en: They had been together for five or six turbulent years of break-ups and reconciliations.
sentences.cn: 他们在一起度过了分分合合动荡不定的五六年。

sentences.en: Wars and conflicts have subjected people living in this area to turbulent life.
sentences.cn: 战争与冲突使该地区的人民过着动荡不安的生活。
